trans-unit.source: Opens an existing named mutex object

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The name of the mutex to be opened. Name comparisons are case sensitive.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the mutex to be opened.
Name comparisons are case sensitive.

target.mrk: The name of the mutex to be opened.
Name comparisons are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The access to the mutex object. The function fails if the security descriptor of the specified object

The access to the mutex object.
The function fails if the security descriptor of the specified object

target.mrk: [optional]
The access to the mutex object.

trans-unit.source: does not permit the requested access for the calling process.

seg-source.mrk: does not permit the requested access for the calling process.

target.mrk: does not permit the requested access for the calling process.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $MUTEX_ALL_ACCESS

target.mrk: $MUTEX_ALL_ACCESS

trans-unit.source: $MUTEX_MODIFY_STATE

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether inherites the handle by a processes, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether inherites the handle by a processes, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether inherites the handle by a processes, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The processes created by this process will inherit the handle.

seg-source.mrk: True - The processes created by this process will inherit the handle.

target.mrk: True - The processes created by this process will inherit the handle.

trans-unit.source: False - The processes do not inherit this handle (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - The processes do not inherit this handle (Default).

target.mrk: False - The processes do not inherit this handle (Default).

trans-unit.source: The function succeeds only if some process has already created the mutex by using the _WinAPI_CreateMutex()

seg-source.mrk: The function succeeds only if some process has already created the mutex by using the _WinAPI_CreateMutex()

target.mrk: The function succeeds only if some process has already created the mutex by using the _WinAPI_CreateMutex()
